com.thalesgroup.gemalto.fido2.authenticator.passcode

Interface KeyboardCallback


  • public interface KeyboardCallback
    An interface to receive relevant keyboard key events
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAuthenticationFailed(int retryCountRemaining)
      Called when Passcode authentication failed and user still has attempts remaining
      void onKeyReceived(KeyboardKey key)
      Called when a key is pressed on the keyboard.
      void onUsageChanged(KeyboardUsage usage)
      Called when the keyboard being displayed changed

    • Method Detail

      • onKeyReceived

        void onKeyReceived(KeyboardKey key)
        Called when a key is pressed on the keyboard.

        The App layer should utilize this callback in order to determine the number of characters to be displayed on a secure input view.

        Key examples include:
        KeyboardKey.INPUT - Add a new secure character (â¬¤) to the text field entry.
        KeyboardKey.DELETE - Remove a secure character from the text field entry.
        KeyboardKey.DONE - Passcode entry is submitted to the FIDO SDK.

        Parameters:
        key - An enum of type KeyboardKey indicating the type of key pressed.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • onAuthenticationFailed

        void onAuthenticationFailed(int retryCountRemaining)
        Called when Passcode authentication failed and user still has attempts remaining

        Retry count limit is 5 before a {Fido2Exception} whose error is {Fido2ErrorCode#USER_LOCKOUT} is thrown. Retry count will reset upon successful user authentication.

        Parameters:
        retryCountRemaining - retry count remaining. On first authentication failed, the value of this property will be 4. On last authentication before will trigger, the value of this property will be 1.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • onUsageChanged

        void onUsageChanged(KeyboardUsage usage)
        Called when the keyboard being displayed changed
        Parameters:
        usage - An enum of type KeyboardUsage indicating what the keyboard is used for
        Since:
        1.0.0
